qas.question: What is a cause of severe environmental issues in the Niger Delta?

answers.text: The presence of companies like Shell

qas.question: Many pipelines owned by Shell in the Niger Delta are described as what?
Shell has accepted responsibility for keeping its pipelines in what condition?
In contrast to its acceptance of responsibility for keeping the pipelines new, Shell has denied what?
Environmental and human rights groups have created action plans to do what?
Where has Shell tried to keep its pipelines in pristine conditions?
When did Friends of the Earth begin protesting Shell?
How many allegations did the Dutch court approve?
Who did Amnesty International have to pay for one count of pollution?
When did Shell acknowledge responsibility for the environmental issues?

context: <a0_0>The presence of companies like Shell<a0_0/> in the <b5_0>Niger-Delta<b5_0/> has led to extreme environmental issues in the Niger Delta. Many pipelines in the Niger-Delta owned by Shell are <a1_0>old and corroded<a1_0/>. Shell has acknowledged its responsibility for keeping the pipelines <a2_0>new<a2_0/> but has also denied <a3_0>responsibility for environmental causes<a3_0/>. This has led to mass protests from the Niger-Delta inhabitants and Amnesty International against Shell and Friends of the Earth Netherlands. It has also led to action plans to <a4_0>boycott Shell<a4_0/> by environmental groups, and human rights groups. In <b6_0>January <b9_0>2013<b9_0/><b6_0/>, a Dutch court rejected <b7_0>four out of five<b7_0/> allegations brought against the firm over oil pollution in the Niger Delta but found a subsidiary guilty of one case of pollution, ordering compensation to be paid to <b8_0>a Nigerian farmer<b8_0/>.
